availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert T Williams (Montgomery County, Kentucky, attorney and major (U.S.A.))

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Williams and Louisa Caroline Morrow Williams. Married to Sarah "Sallie" W. Gill Williams in Douglas County, Illinois, on May 10, 1865. Attended school in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned thirteen enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Attended Missouri University in Boone County, Missouri, from 1855 to 1856. Attorney in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned eighteen enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from October 9, 1861, to December 9, 1862. Accused of desertion from November 1862 to December 1862. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as major from March 25, 1863, to September 16, 1863.
